00031 class TimeWarper;

00033 #define PLUGIN_EFFECT   0x0001
00034 #define BUILTIN_EFFECT  0x0002
00035 // ADVANCED_EFFECT was introduced for Lynn Allan's 'CleanSpeech'
00036 // it allows the list of effects to be filtered to exclude
00037 // the advanced effects.
00038 #define ADVANCED_EFFECT 0x0004
00039 // HIDDEN_EFFECT allows an item to be excluded from the effects
00040 // menu in both CleanSpeech and in normal builds.
00041 #define HIDDEN_EFFECT   0x0008
00042 
00043 #define INSERT_EFFECT   0x0010
00044 #define PROCESS_EFFECT  0x0020
00045 #define ANALYZE_EFFECT  0x0040
00046 #define ALL_EFFECTS     0x00FF
00047 
00048 // Flag used to disable prompting for configuration
00049 // parameteres.
00050 #define CONFIGURED_EFFECT 0x8000
00051 
00052 //CLEAN-ME: Rogue value to skip unwanted effects in a chain.
00053 //lda: SKIP_EFFECT_MILLISECOND is a rogue value, used where a millisecond
00054 //time is required to indicate "Don't do this effect".
00055 //It is used in SpikeCleaner and TruncSilence.
00056 //MERGE: Maybe we can remove this now that we have configurable batch
00057 //and so can just drop the steps we don't want?
00058 #define SKIP_EFFECT_MILLISECOND 99999
00059 
00060 class AUDACITY_DLL_API Effect {
00061  // 
00062  // public methods
00063  //
00064  // Used by the outside program to determine properties of an effect and
00065  // apply the effect to one or more tracks.
00066  // 
00067  public:
00068    // Each subclass of Effect should override this method.
00069    // This name will go in the menu bar;
00070    // append "..." if your effect pops up a dialog
00071    virtual wxString GetEffectName() = 0;
00072 
00073    // Each subclass of Effect should override this method.
00074    // This should return the category of this effect, which
00075    // will determine where in the menu it's placed.
00076 #ifdef EFFECT_CATEGORIES
00077    virtual std::set<wxString> GetEffectCategories() = 0;
00078 #endif
00079 
00080    // Totally optional - if you need a way to identify your effect
00081    // from somewhere else in the program.  This should be human-readable,
00082    // but should NOT be translated.  Use wxT(""), not _("").
00083    virtual wxString GetEffectIdentifier() { return wxT(""); }
00084    
00085    // Each subclass of Effect should override this method.
00086    // This name will go in the progress dialog, but can be used
00087    // elsewhere, and it should describe what is being done.
00088    // For example, if the effect is "Filter", the action is
00089    // "Filtering", or if the effect is "Bass Boost", the action
00090    // is "Boosting Bass Frequencies".
00091    virtual wxString GetEffectAction() = 0;
00092 
00093    // Each subclass of Effect should override this method. 
00094    // This description will go in the History state. 
00095    // Override to include effect parameters, so typically useful only after PromptUser. 
00096    virtual wxString GetEffectDescription() { 
00097       // Default provides effect name. 
00098       return wxString::Format(_("Applied effect: %s"), 
00099                               this->GetEffectName().c_str()); 
00100    } 
00101     
00102    // Return flags which tell you what kind of effect this is.
00103    // It will be either a built-in or a plug-in effect, and it
00104    // will be one of Insert, Process, or Analyze.
00105    virtual int GetEffectFlags() {
00106       // Default of BUILTIN_EFFECT | PROCESS_EFFECT | ADVANCED_EFFECT (set in constructor) - 
00107       // covers most built-in effects.
00108       return mFlags;
00109    }
00110 
00111    virtual bool TransferParameters( Shuttle & shuttle ){
00112       return true;
00113    }
00114 
00115    void SetEffectFlags( int NewFlags )
00116    {
00117       mFlags = NewFlags;
00118    }
00119 
00120    // The Effect class fully implements the Preview method for you.
00121    // Only override it if you need to do preprocessing or cleanup.
00122    virtual void Preview();
00123 
00124    // Get an unique ID assigned to each registered effect.
00125    // The first effect will have ID zero.
00126    int GetID() {
00127       return mID;
00128    }
00129 
00130    // Returns true on success.  Will only operate on tracks that
00131    // have the "selected" flag set to true, which is consistent with
00132    // Audacity's standard UI.
00133    bool DoEffect(wxWindow *parent, int flags, double projectRate, TrackList *list,
00134                  TrackFactory *factory, double *t0, double *t1, wxString params);
00135 
00136    wxString GetPreviewName();
00137 
00138    // Strip ampersand ('&' char) from string. This effectively removes the
00139    // shortcut from the string ('E&qualizer' becomes 'Equalizer'). This is
00140    // important for sorting.
00141    static wxString StripAmpersand(const wxString& str);
00142 
00143  //
00144  // protected virtual methods
00145  //
00146  // Each subclass of Effect overrides one or more of these methods to
00147  // do its processing.
00148  //
00149  protected:
00150    // The constructor.  Called once at the beginning of the program.
00151    // Avoid allocating memory or doing time-consuming processing here.
00152    Effect();
00153 
00154    //The destructor.
00155    virtual ~Effect();
00156  
00157    // Called once each time an effect is called.  Perform any initialization;
00158    // make sure that the effect can be performed on the selected tracks and
00159    // return false otherwise
00160    virtual bool Init() {
00161       return true;
00162    }
00163 
00164    // If necessary, open a dialog to get parameters from the user.
00165    // This method will not always be called (for example if a user
00166    // repeats an effect) but if it is called, it will be called
00167    // after Init.
00168    virtual bool PromptUser() {
00169       return true;
00170    }
00171    // Check whether effect should be skipped
00172    // Typically this is only useful in automation, for example
00173    // detecting that zero noise reduction is to be done,
00174    // or that normalisation is being done without Dc bias shift 
00175    // or amplitude modification
00176    virtual bool CheckWhetherSkipEffect() { return false; }
00177       
00178    // Actually do the effect here.
00179    virtual bool Process() = 0;
00180 
00181    // clean up any temporary memory
00182    virtual void End() {
00183    }
00184 
00185 
00186  //
00187  // protected data
00188  //
00189  // The Effect base class will set these variables, some or all of which
00190  // may be needed by any particular subclass of Effect.
00191  //
00192  protected:
00193    wxWindow       *mParent;
00194    ProgressDialog *mProgress;
00195    double         mProjectRate; // Sample rate of the project - new tracks should
00196                                // be created with this rate...
00197    TrackFactory   *mFactory;
00198    TrackList      *mTracks;      // the complete list of all tracks
00199    TrackList      *mOutputTracks; // used only if CopyInputTracks() is called.
00200    double         mT0;
00201    double         mT1;
00202    TimeWarper     *mWarper;
00203 
00204  //
00205  // protected methods
00206  //
00207  // These methods can be used by subclasses of Effect in order to display a
00208  // progress dialog or perform common calculations
00209  //
00210  protected:
00211    // The Progress methods all return true if the user has cancelled;
00212    // you should exit immediately if this happens (cleaning up memory
00213    // is okay, but don't try to undo).
00214  
00215    // Pass a fraction between 0.0 and 1.0
00216    bool TotalProgress(double frac);
00217    
00218    // Pass a fraction between 0.0 and 1.0, for the current track
00219    // (when doing one track at a time)
00220    bool TrackProgress(int whichTrack, double frac);
00221  
00222    // Pass a fraction between 0.0 and 1.0, for the current track group
00223    // (when doing stereo groups at a time)
00224    bool TrackGroupProgress(int whichGroup, double frac);
00225 
00226    int GetNumWaveTracks() { return mNumTracks; }
00227 
00228    int GetNumWaveGroups() { return mNumGroups; }
00229 
00230    // Calculates the start time and selection length in samples
00231    void GetSamples(WaveTrack *track, sampleCount *start, sampleCount *len);
00232 
00233    void SetTimeWarper(TimeWarper *warper);
00234    TimeWarper *GetTimeWarper();
00235 
00236  //
00237  // protected static data
00238  //
00239  // Preferences shared by all effects
00240  //
00241  protected:
00242    static double sDefaultGenerateLen;
00243    int mFlags;
00244    double mLength;
00245 
00246    // type of the tracks on mOutputTracks
00247    int mOutputTracksType;
00248  
00249  //
00250  // private methods
00251  //
00252    // Use these two methods to copy the input tracks to mOutputTracks, if 
00253    // doing the processing on them, and replacing the originals only on success (and not cancel).
00254    void CopyInputTracks(int trackType = Track::Wave);
00255 
00256    // If bGoodResult, replace mWaveTracks tracks in mTracks with successfully processed 
00257    // mOutputTracks copies, get rid of old mWaveTracks, and set mWaveTracks to mOutputTracks. 
00258    // Else clear and delete mOutputTracks copies.
00259    void ReplaceProcessedTracks(const bool bGoodResult);
00260 
00261    // Use this to append a new output track.
00262    void AddToOutputTracks(Track *t);
00263 
00264  // Used only by the base Effect class
00265  //
00266  private:
00267    void CountWaveTracks();
00268  
00269  //
00270  // private data
00271  //
00272  // Used only by the base Effect class
00273  //
00274  private:
00275    wxArrayPtrVoid mIMap;
00276    wxArrayPtrVoid mOMap;
00277 
00278    int mNumTracks; //v This is really mNumWaveTracks, per CountWaveTracks() and GetNumWaveTracks().
00279    int mNumGroups;
00280 
00281    int mID;
00282    
00283    friend class BatchCommands;// so can call PromptUser.
00284    friend class EffectManager;// so it can delete effects and access mID.
00285 
00286 };

00293 // Base dialog for regular effect
00294 class AUDACITY_DLL_API EffectDialog:public wxDialog
00295 {
00296 public:
00297    // constructors and destructors
00298    EffectDialog(wxWindow * parent,
00299                 const wxString & title,
00300                 int type = PROCESS_EFFECT,
00301                 int flags = wxDEFAULT_DIALOG_STYLE);
00302 
00303    void Init();
00304 
00305    virtual void PopulateOrExchange(ShuttleGui & S);
00306    virtual bool TransferDataToWindow();
00307    virtual bool TransferDataFromWindow();
00308    virtual bool Validate();
00309    virtual void OnPreview(wxCommandEvent & event);
00310 
00311 private:
00312    int mType;
00313 };
